articles.description: Follow live commentary and text updates from the Rugby World Cup as Wales play Fiji at the Stade de Bordeaux.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: Wales v Fiji – radio & text

articles.description: Novak Djokovic faces Daniil Medvedev in the US Open men's singles final - follow radio and text commentary.
articles.title: US Open final: Djokovic v Medvedev - build-up

articles.description: Liam Livingstone's 95 sets up a series-levelling victory for England against New Zealand in Southampton.
articles.title: Livingstone-inspired England beat New Zealand to level ODI series

articles.description: Scotland slip to defeat in their World Cup opener as defending champions South Africa put in a typically ruthless and powerful display in Marseille.
articles.title: Ruthless South Africa too strong for Scotland

articles.description: Text coverage of the Group B encounter with the Republic of Ireland taking on Netherlands at the Aviva Stadium in Dublin.
articles.title: Euro 2024 qualifiers: Build-up to Republic of Ireland v Netherlands

articles.description: England have sent a reminder to the World Cup's big guns with their performance against Argentina, says Matt Dawson.
articles.title: 'Ford had freedom to take control in Farrell absence'

articles.description: Injury-hit Northern Ireland's Euro 2024 qualifier misery continued as a 1-0 defeat away to Kazakhstan stretched their losing streak to five matches.
articles.title: NI's misery continues with defeat in Kazakhstan

articles.description: Hansi Flick is dismissed as manager of Euro 2024 hosts Germany following a poor run of results.
articles.title: Flick sacked as Germany boss following poor run

articles.description: Watch highlights as England comfortably beat New Zealand by 79 runs to level the one-day international series in a rain-affected encounter at Southampton.
articles.title: Livingstone helps England beat NZ to level ODI series

articles.description: Sweden's Vincent Norrman shoots a closing 65 to win the Irish Open as Rory McIlroy blows his chances by finding water four times.
articles.title: Norrman wins Irish Open as McIlroy hopes are sunk
